outputs.output_descr:
The joint United Nations Millennium Village Project aims at establishing a relation between Science and Technology and integrated rural development to strengthen communities and district authorities capacities in the development, planning, implementation and Monitoring and Evaluation of infrastructure and services, over a minimum of a three-year timeframe. 
The Project will create capacities through the provision of systematic goods, training, monitoring and evaluation and Information Communications Technologies as well as development of and access to markets. The villages initially exposed to the project will later be acting as training of trainers and suppliers of goods to the neighbouring communities in order to accelerate impact and to promote local partnerships and economies.
The activities will be coordinated and combined with existing decentralised development planning tools and interventions in order to scale-up planned interventions, aiming at contributing to the following outputs:

1.	Increased agricultural production and productivity in the Village
2.	Improved  access to education and quality social services
3.	Improved access to health, water and sanitation

This is done by using a Local Economic Development (LED) focus in strategic and participatory planning in Mozambique. The programme is coordinated nationally by the Ministry of State Administration, through the National Directorate for the Promotion of Rural Development (DNPDR) within UNDP National Implementation Modality. The Program aims to cover all territories in Mozambique and ART-PAPDEL is in the Cabo Delgado, Nampula, Gaza and Inhambane Provinces. Its main purpose is to operationalize the Action Plan for the Reduction of Absolute Poverty and the attainment of MDGs (PARPA II), which, amongst its goals, it encourages "rural development as the process of improving living conditions and of pro-rural transformation of the pattern of wealth creation and accumulation in Mozambique". ART-PAPDEL's strategy foresees the strengthening of technical, human and institutional capacities in LED at the different levels as well as an active and efficient coordination amongst LED actors.  At the local and national level, ART-PAPDEL's expected results are strengthening institutions relevant for LED; including the LED approach into local planning processes; promoting and supporting business initiatives; establishing local coordination mechanisms; establishing knowledge in LED management system as well as drawing up and approving a LED Strategic Plan. At the international level, the programme include participation in/or organisation of events in order to draw together the LED actors in dynamic networks of knowledge in the spirit of South-South, North-South and South-North cooperation.

project_title: Support to Local Government Effectiveness and Efficiency
